name: Hampton Inn Santa Cruz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried to get a room in the Express by Holiday Inn opposite to the Hampton, however they were fully booked and recommended we try here. We were so glad they did!
reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes, excellent hotel
Good stopover
reviews.text: The receptionist was polite and helpful throughout our stay and seemed happy to help with any of our queries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was excellent, spacious, clean and bright and felt genuinely welcoming after a long day of travelling. Breakfast was also good and served everything you'd expect for the type of hotel it was.
reviews.title: The staff makes this place worth the stay

reviews.text: My only issue was the location. I didn't feel comfortable walking out at night in this area.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay!

reviews.text: If I could plunk this Hampton down in a different location, I'd rate it more enthusiastically. It was absolutely fine as far as comfort, cleanliness, etc. but the location just isn't very appealing due to a gas station right by it, and it's a busy area. We were just on a one night stopover so it was fine, and once inside we were perfectly content.
reviews.title: Very comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We should have heeded the warnings about the sketchy area surrounding this hotel. We were victims of a theft in the parking lot and though the place was actually a decent hotel, this colored our view of our stay. In addition, the price of the hotel was not commensurate with the unsafe environment. When we checked in we told the front desk we had bikes locked in the back bed of the truck. The desk clerk noted that the truck was in full view of the front desk and the desk was manned 24 hours so we should be ok. He did note that IF we wanted to we could take the bikes inside our room. We had been to over 8 hotels in the western region with the bikes in the back (locked down with secure cables) so it made sense that in full view we should be ok here too. This was not the case. In the morning we discovered that one bike seat was missing and the other one had been attempted to be removed. So much for them being “in full view”. The area surrounding this hotel is very seedy so it’s best that every precaution be taken when staying here. We alerted the manager in the morning and made the suggestion that they tell their customers to ALWAYS take their bikes in. The manager said they always suggest this to their customers, but guess the desk clerk that we got didn’t get the memo. If we were to ever visit Santa Cruz again, which is highly unlikely, we might stay here again IF everything else was booked. It would be more likely that we stay at the Holiday Inn Express across the street instead.
reviews.title: Heed the warnings

reviews.text: I've been to this hotel many times just a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: great & wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sue & Ray are the best.
reviews.title: Our UC Santa Cruz Favorite

reviews.text: There housekepping staff are wonderful & friendly. Also the front desk staff are great as well.
reviews.title: Quality, comfort, and clean hotel at affordable prices.

reviews.text: LuLu is wonderfull as the hostess at breakfast.
reviews.title: CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, QUIET, CONVENIENT

reviews.text: I stay over 200 night a year at Hilton, Hampton Inn or one of the other partnering hotels. This hotel was awesome. Clean, nice rooms, and they gave me a free access to the Gold's Gym down the street. Overall just a great stay and Angelo at the front desk was so accommodating. If you are looking for a great stay in Santa Cruz here you go!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn with my wife. We were there to watch my daughter compete in a triathlon, and they did all they could to accomodate all of our needs and hers. The manager offered to upgrade us to a suite in the event that our daughter needed a place to stay, and even looked up kennels for the dog she was traveling with. Breakfast was great, rooms were great, and the service was exceptional. All around, a big thumbs up!
reviews.title: Fantastic service and management - clean, lovely rooms

reviews.text: At Hampton Inn Santa Cruz, the staff is helpful and accommodating -- from the moment you arrive up until the moment of your departure. The housekeeping staff is especially helpful and cater to your needs. Housekeeping supervisor Sue is great. She immediately remembered me from a previous visit and proceeded to ensure that my recent stay was a pleasant one.
reviews.title: If you like comfort and a friendly atmosphere, Hampton Inn Santa Cruz is the place for you.

reviews.text: If you are sensitive to noise, make sure to ask for a room on the "quiet" side, especially if you are staying more than one night. The rooms on the street side tend to be a bit noisy from the traffic.
reviews.title: Great place but a bit on the expensive side

reviews.text: And be sure to make your reservation on line -- it is really easy.
reviews.title: Its a nice place but way too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel....but......
reviews.title: Our second visit.....ok, but....

reviews.text: We stayed here the night of August 12th. We were visiting Santa Cruz with friends, who stayed elsewhere, to visit downtown and the boardwalk. Wanted to save on breakfast expenses for two and get a good nights rest.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: The Hampton Inn is a bit on the spartan side, but meets the needs of the guests. We had a room with a King bed. The room was small and we could barely squeeze by the foot of the bed between the bed and the tv cabinet. The bed was very comfortable. The room was clean.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Had a comfortable chair with footrest and a writing desk. But everything was tight in the small room and with luggage on the one rack, that left the desk and floor for suitcases.
reviews.title: Great spot for visiting UCSC

reviews.text: The bathroom was also tiny, but complete. Had a choice of typical amenities and a curved shower rod, but very few hooks or racks to hang towels. Just basic. Did anyone give some thought to making this room comfortable beyond the necessities? No decorations on the walls.
reviews.title: We had a great family reunion at the Santa Cruz Hampton Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I only spent 1 night at this hotel on our way down Highway 1. The check-in process was smooth and the staff were friendly. The room was large (we had 2 double beds in our room) and the beds were comfortable and had a choice of pillows.
reviews.title: Cheap and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast the next morning had a huge variety of options, hot and cold and all self service so was very relaxed. We paid $115 for the night so felt it was good value for money.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for Santa Cruz

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for Santa Cruz CA where the majority of the lodgings are subpar. The beds are great and the rooms are nice and large. The negatives are that there was no work desk, the bathroom door had to be held open with a door stopper, and the front desk folks are not very friendly. The hot breakfast is terrible. Breakfast is served until 10 but when we got there at 9 on both days the hot items were gone and we had to ask for the items to be replenished. It seems that no one watches over the food. The coffee containers also takes a long time to be refilled.
reviews.title: Okay, not the best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel to Santa Cruz often to visit family and we will stay here again due to the lack of other options.
reviews.title: Lives up to the hype

likes.liked: — Nice room, clean bathroom, free internet, price.

reviews.text: I came to this site to write a not-so-good review of this hotel. I see that all before me really liked this hotel. I checked out after the first night. For work, I stay at Hampton Inns a lot., nearly every week. While this hotel was the worst Hampton Inn I've stayed at, I do agree it is not that bad overall.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, lives up to reviews

description: Welcome to the Hampton Inn Santa Cruz, a captivating California coast hotel. Treat yourself to our lovely retreat located near everything you'd ever need to make your visit the best it can be. Delight in superb sandy beaches, fascinating local history, out-of-this-world attractions and exceptionally fine dining. Experience a veritable vacation paradise in Santa Cruz. Our hospitable hotel puts you in perfect proximity to the beach, boardwalk and dozens of amazing attractions less than 2 miles away.
